article.description: U of the Pacific 58, UC Riverside 45
article.headline: U of the Pacific 58, UC Riverside 45
article.linkText: U of the Pacific 58, UC Riverside 45
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- David Doubley scored a game-high 18 points and Pacific began defense of its Big West Conference championship Tuesday night with a 58-45 victory over UC Riverside. The Tigers (6-2, 1-0) ended the game with an 8-0 run after Riverside had closed within five points with 4:14 remaining. Pacific won its 14th consecutive Big West regular-season game dating to last season and prevailed in its Big West opener for the seventh consecutive year. Christian Maraker had 11 points and 10 rebounds and reserve Guillaume Yango had 10 points and 11 rebounds for the Tigers, who held a 44-27 rebounding advantage. Reserve Justin Bell scored 10 points to lead the Highlanders (4-5, 0-1). Riverside closed within 31-28 early in the second half but never could get any closer. Doubley, who played a game-high 37 minutes, scored 13 points after halftime to keep Pacific in control. Pacific's tough defense forced nine turnovers and limited UC Riverside to 33 percent shooting from the field in the first half as the Tigers took a 29-22 lead. Pacific had a 13-point lead with four minutes left before the half, but poor shooting the rest of the way allowed the Highlanders to close the gap by halftime. Pacific shot 41 percent from the field and made just five of 12 free throws in the opening 20 minutes. Pacific's shooting got better in the second half. Riverside's didn't. The Highlanders couldn't convert scoring opportunities down the stretch, finishing with a shooting percentage of 29.6 after making just seven of 27 field-goal attempts after halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
